item.title: A trip to Seoul
item.description: What a nice trip it was.

item.title: Apple Tarts
item.description: If you want to add a story to the recipe, but hide it from the reader unless he chooses to read it, place the text inside. Unfortunately, you will have to write it in html and not markdown. Ingredients (8-10 tarts) For the puff pastry: 250g flour (or 2 cups and 1 heaped tablespoon) 250g butter (or 1 cup and 1 tablespoon) 1-1.5dl lukewarm water (or a little over 1/3 cup to a little less than 2/3 cups) 3g salt (0.

item.title: Easter Bread II
item.description: Ingredients (2 loaves) 500g flour (or 4 1/4 cups) 100g butter (or 1/2 cup) 15g fresh yeast (or 0.5oz) 3 tablespoons sugar 2 small eggs 2,5dl milk (plus a little more to dissolve the yeast) (or 1 cup and 1 tablespoon) 1 teaspoon salt 1 teaspoon cinnamon 1 teaspoon fennel seeds chopped or powdered 2 boiled eggs (optional) Instructions (Time: 4 hours) Start by dissolving the yeast in a bit of warm milk.

item.title: Roasted Pork Carré
item.description: Ingredients (4 servings) 1,5kg pork carré (or 3.3lbs) 3 garlic cloves 3 onions 1 sage leaf 1 lemon 2dl white wine (or 3/4 cup) olive oil, salt, pepper q.s. Instructions (Time: 90 minutes) Place the garlic cloves grossly chopped, the onions sliced in 4, the bay leaf and some olive oil on the bottom of a baking dish. Lay the pork carré on top of the onions with the bones down.

item.title: About
item.description: This page uses the single page layout. It’s a good place to leave your contact.
